data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The starting point is always forward.. On all movements one only has 12 steps. The starting point is on the opposite side of the equation with 9 steps left, and 10 steps forward. Thus, the answer is Yes.

At the beginning of the directions it says take 4 steps and turn around. At the turn around, it says to stop and turn around. So, the answer is No.

If you were taken 6 steps then you could walk to your starting point. If you were taken 4 steps then you could walk to where you started at. So, the answer is yes.

One step backwards is one step forward. You can only have 7 steps take a step at a time only taking one step backwards. So, the answer is yes.

You can only turn around and start from the same point. So, the answer is No.

Turn left twice, take 7 steps, repeat this process. Take right twice, take 7 steps, repeat this process. To make 5 more turns, you take 10 + 7 = 20 + 7 = 26 total turns. So, the answer is Yes.

Taking 6 steps back and walking 2 steps back is equivalent to taking 6 first and 8 last. So, the answer is yes.

If you face forward, your body will always be facing forward. The answer is yes.

The first step outward is always facing forward. The second step outward is facing right. The third step outward is facing left. You start facing in the direction you are facing now. A step backward goes back in one direction only. A step left going in one direction goes straight in the other direction. So, the answer is yes.

Rebound steps make your left foot drop backwards, while forward steps make the right foot go forward. The direction you took your steps is determined by how you take your steps. Always face forward. In order to take 5 steps backward you should always be facing forward. In order to take 4 steps backward you should always be facing backwards. In order to take 9 steps forward you should always be facing forward. You are always backwards if you are taking 4 steps backward. Thus, the answer is No.

Rewind, step backward, step left, and step forward are all steps forward. Correctly doing each step reverses the order. Correctly completing each step backward brings you back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
